title: Windows
text: Check that you computer meets the minimum system requirements. If you followed the instructions for setting up Windows using UTM in either MacOS (Apple Silicon or Intel), you should be good to go. Be sure you are working within your Windows virtual machine for the following steps.

title: Windows
text: Check that you computer meets the minimum system requirements. If you followed the instructions for setting up Windows using UTM in either MacOS (Apple Silicon or Intel), you should be good to go. Be sure you are working within your Windows virtual machine for the following steps.

title: Windows
text:
Install .NET SDK 6.0 (x64)
ArcGIS Pro requires .NET SDK 6.0 for x64 processors. The presence of Microsoft .NET Desktop Runtime 7 or for any other architecture is inconsequential.
Follow these instructions to install the correct .NET SDK.

Open a browser and navigate to https://dotnet.microsoft.com/en-us/download/dotnet/6.0.
You will see a grid of options for installing the .NET SDK. Under the Installers column and Windows row, click the x64 link to begin the download.


Navigate to the downloaded file, and double click to begin the installation process. Follow the instructions in the installer, accepting all defaults.
Restart the Windows VM.

title: Windows
text:
Install ArcGIS Pro

Download the ArcGIS Pro installer.

Navigate to https://umontana.maps.arcgis.com and click Sign In in the upper right. You will be prompted to sign in with your UM NetID.
Click your name in the upper right and go to My Settings > Licenses. On the list of product licenses, you’ll see a Download link for ArcGIS Pro. Click it to start the download.



Launch the downloaded installer, and follow the on-screen instructions to install ArcGIS Pro.

title: Windows
text:
Activate ArcGIS Pro

Launch ArcGIS Pro.
At the sign on page, click Your Organization’s URL.
In the empty field, enter umontana so the URL completes to umontana.maps.arcgis.com.
Do not enter anything other than “umontana”. Anything else simply won’t work.
Click Continue, then click the UM NetID button.
Sign in with your NetID and password at the UM NetID SSO page. Activation should happen automatically.

title: MacOS (Apple Silicon)
text:
UTM employs Apple’s Hypervisor virtualization framework to run other operating systems on Mac processors at near native speeds. It is a free alternative to virtualization software such as Parallels, with impressive performance.
There are three ways to install UTM:

Download UTM from https://mac.getutm.app. Click the “Download” link. Open the UTM.dmg disk image file that was downloaded, and drag UTM.app into the Applications folder.
Install UTM from the Mac App Store. UTM is free, but if you install it from the Mac App Store, it will cost you $9.99. Benefits of installing from the App store include automatic updates, and you will be supporting the continued development of UTM and the QEMU emulator its built upon.
If you use Homebrew for app management on your Mac, install UTM via homebrew in Terminal: brew install utm.

title: MacOS (Apple Silicon)
text:
UTM employs Apple’s Hypervisor virtualization framework to run other operating systems on Mac processors at near native speeds. It is a free alternative to virtualization software such as Parallels, with impressive performance.
There are three ways to install UTM:

Download UTM from https://mac.getutm.app. Click the “Download” link. Open the UTM.dmg disk image file that was downloaded, and drag UTM.app into the Applications folder.
Install UTM from the Mac App Store. UTM is free, but if you install it from the Mac App Store, it will cost you $9.99. Benefits of installing from the App store include automatic updates, and you will be supporting the continued development of UTM and the QEMU emulator its built upon.
If you use Homebrew for app management on your Mac, install UTM via homebrew in Terminal: brew install utm.

title: MacOS (Apple Silicon)
section: Download Windows 11 for ARM Preview VHDX
text:
Download Windows 11 for ARM Preview VHDX

Navigate to https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/software-download/windowsinsiderpreviewARM64.
Sign into microsoft.com in the upper right corner of the page using your first.last@umt.edu user ID.

If you see, “To access this page, you need to be a member of the Windows Insider program,” you’ll need to sign up for the “Windows Insider” program.

Navigate to https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/windowsinsider/register.
Read through the notices, and select the “I accept the terms of this agreement” check box.
Click “Register now”.
Return https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/software-download/windowsinsiderpreviewARM64 to continue.


You should be on a page entitled “Windows Insider Preview Downloads”. Click the drop down menu and select the “Windows 11 Client Arm64 Insider Preview (Beta) - Build xxxxx” option. Disregard the build number; these change often. Click “Confirm”.
A new drop down will appear inviting you to “Select the product language.” English will likely be the only option. Select your language. Click “Confirm”.
A download link for the Windows VHDX should appear. Click “Download Now”. The download is large (~10 Gb) and will take some time, especially on a wifi connection. Note where the file downloads to.

title: MacOS (Apple Silicon)
section: Install a New Virtual Machine with Windows 11 for ARM Preview
text:
Install a New Virtual Machine with Windows 11 for ARM Preview

Open UTM.app, and click the + sign at the top of the window to install a new virtual machine.
Select “Virtualize”.
Select “Windows”
Select the “Import VHDX Image” check box.
Click the “Browse…” button, and navigate to the downloaded Windows 11 VHDX image. Click “Continue”.
Select the amount of memory and number of CPU cores for the Windows virtual machine. You can accept the default values, or increase the memory and CPU cores to your liking. It is advisable to not use more than half of your computer’s total memory or number of cores. Click “Continue”.
You may specify a shared directory that will be mapped to the Windows virtual machine from your local machine. This is optional. Click “Continue”.
Review the Summary, changing the Windows virtual machine’s name if you’d like, and click “Save”.
Your new Windows virtual machine should appear in the left column of the UTM window. Click the “play” button (the triangle) to launch the virtual machine. The machine should start up and begin the Windows installation process.
Continue through the process of installing Windows in the virtual machine. You may encounter issues; the guide at https://docs.getutm.app/guides/windows/ may be useful. When installing on an M1 MacBook Pro, we ran into trouble with a network check during install. This can be solved by:

Go to the language select screen (you may need to restart the setup if you are past this screen).
Press Shift + F10 to launch Command Prompt.
Type in OOBE\BYPASSNRO and press Enter.
Your VM should reboot and at the setup screen you should see an option for “I don’t have internet.” Click that, and then “Continue with limited setup,” and you should be able to continue with the installation.

Once Windows starts, click the file explorer, and select the CD drive. Click the “spice-guest-tools” installer, which installs important drivers to run windows on a Mac. Reboot when prompted.
You may want to adjust the video settings on your Windows VM. To do so, shut down the Windows VM, and in the UTM app, and then, with the Windows VM selected in the left hand menu, click the button that looks like three sliders in the upper right corner. Navigate down to “Display” and click the “Retina Mode” check box. Click “Save”, and restart the Windows VM. Resolution should be roughly double.
At this point, it is good to install any updates to Windows that are available. Click the Start menu and search for “Settings”; go to Settings. Towards the top of the Settings window you should see a “Windows Update” button. Check for updates, and install any that are available.

title: MacOS (Apple Silicon)
text:
Install ArcGIS Pro
Continue your installation from within the new Windows Virtual Machine by following the Windows install instructions.

title: MacOS (Intel)
text:
UTM employs Apple’s Hypervisor virtualization framework to run other operating systems on Mac processors at near native speeds. It is a free alternative to virtualization software such as Parallels, with impressive performance.
There are three ways to install UTM:

Download UTM from https://mac.getutm.app. Click the “Download” link. Open the UTM.dmg disk image file that was downloaded, and drag UTM.app into the Applications folder.
Install UTM from the Mac App Store. UTM is free, but if you install it from the Mac App Store, it will cost you $9.99. Benefits of installing from the App store include automatic updates, and you will be supporting the continued development of UTM and the QEMU emulator its built upon.
If you use Homebrew for app management on your Mac, install UTM via homebrew in Terminal: brew install utm.

title: MacOS (Intel)
text:
UTM employs Apple’s Hypervisor virtualization framework to run other operating systems on Mac processors at near native speeds. It is a free alternative to virtualization software such as Parallels, with impressive performance.
There are three ways to install UTM:

Download UTM from https://mac.getutm.app. Click the “Download” link. Open the UTM.dmg disk image file that was downloaded, and drag UTM.app into the Applications folder.
Install UTM from the Mac App Store. UTM is free, but if you install it from the Mac App Store, it will cost you $9.99. Benefits of installing from the App store include automatic updates, and you will be supporting the continued development of UTM and the QEMU emulator its built upon.
If you use Homebrew for app management on your Mac, install UTM via homebrew in Terminal: brew install utm.

title: MacOS (Intel)
text:
Download Windows 11 Preview ISO

Navigate to https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/software-download/windowsinsiderpreviewiso.
Sign into microsoft.com in the upper right corner of the page using your first.last@umt.edu user ID.

If you see, “To access this page, you need to be a member of the Windows Insider program,” you’ll need to sign up for the “Windows Insider” program.

Navigate to https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/windowsinsider/register.
Read through the notices, and select the “I accept the terms of this agreement” check box.
Click “Register now”.
Return https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/software-download/windowsinsiderpreviewiso to continue.


You should be on a page entitled “Windows Insider Preview Downloads”. Toward the bottom of the page, click the drop down menu and select the “Windows 11 Insider Preview (Release Preview Channel) - Build xxxxx” option. Disregard the build number; these change often. Click “Confirm”.
A new drop down will appear inviting you to “Select the product language.” Select your language. Click “Confirm”.
A download link for the Windows ISO should appear. Click “64-bit Download”. The download is large (~6.6 Gb) and will take some time, especially on a wifi connection. Note where the file downloads to.

title: MacOS (Intel)
section: Install a New Virtual Machine with Windows 11 Preview
text:
Install a New Virtual Machine with Windows 11 Preview

Open UTM.app, and click the + sign at the top of the window to install a new virtual machine.
Select “Virtualize”.
Select “Windows”
Click the “Browse…” button, and navigate to the downloaded Windows 11 Preview ISO image that you downloaded above. Click “Continue”.
Select the amount of memory and number of CPU cores for the Windows virtual machine. You can accept the default values, or increase the memory and CPU cores to your liking. It is advisable to not use more than half of your computer’s total memory or number of cores. Click “Continue”.
You may specify a shared directory that will be mapped to the Windows virtual machine from your local machine. This is optional. Click “Continue”.
Review the Summary, changing the Windows virtual machine’s name if you’d like, and click “Save”.
Your new Windows virtual machine should appear in the left column of the UTM window. Click the “play” button (the triangle) to launch the virtual machine. The machine should start up and begin the Windows installation process. When prompted, “press any key to boot from CD or DVD…”; this will start the installer.
Continue through the process of installing Windows in the virtual machine. You may encounter issues; the guide at https://docs.getutm.app/guides/windows/ may be useful. When prompted to activate windows with a product key, select “I don’t have a product key” at the bottom of the window to continue (or, enter one if you have one on hand). I’ve found activating Windows is unnecessary, at least for the short term.
Once Windows starts, click the file explorer, and select the CD drive. Click the “spice-guest-tools” installer, which installs important drivers to run windows on a Mac. Reboot when prompted.
You may want to adjust the video settings on your Windows VM. To do so, shut down the Windows VM, and in the UTM app, and then, with the Windows VM selected in the left hand menu, click the button that looks like three sliders in the upper right corner. Navigate down to “Display” and click the “Retina Mode” check box. Click “Save”, and restart the Windows VM. Resolution should be roughly double.
At this point, it is good to install any updates to Windows that are available. Click the Start menu and search for “Settings”; go to Settings. Towards the top of the Settings window you should see a “Windows Update” button. Check for updates, and install any that are available.

title: MacOS (Intel)
text:
Install ArcGIS Pro
Continue your installation from within the new Windows Virtual Machine by following the Windows install instructions.
